sentence.idiomatic: He has lots of relatives. When he got married he has prepared a lot of invitations.
As a beauty consultant, she often gets invitations to cosmetics conferences.
Yikes--received another invitation. What a pain.
They decided to have the wedding reception according to tradition at their original home.
Last week I went to a friend's wedding reception. A ton of guests showed up.
You have been dating for so long, when will you be inviting me to your wedding reception?
He is really concerned about saving face. In front of others he has never spoken about his difficulties.
Little sister is getting married and you only gave such a small amount in the red envelope, we'll definitely lose face.
You'll even argue at my house, you're not giving me any face.
He kept on proposing toasts to his elders--in the end he got drunk himself.
The president personally came and proposed a toast. You certainly got a lot of face.
I have a poor tolerance for alcohol, thus let's not one by one propose a toast. Let's all toast a glass together.
My doing this was definitely not of my own initiative, I was forced by others.
Various pressures of life forced him to give up his ideals.
I feel that I haven't done wrong, but mother on the other hand is forcing me to go apologize to my classmate.
His group of friends played a ton of practical jokes, they exhausted the groom and the bride while hazing them.
Wait until you get married--we'll have to make sure to do a lot of hazing of the newlyweds.
The groom and the bride have to figure out how to counter their friends' hazing.
He doesn't like this kind of occasion too much. He would always look for an opportunity to run away.
This is the peak tourist time--tourists should be on guard against travel agents taking the opportunity to raise their prices.
Taking the opportunity to retaliate when others meet with misfortune--this way of doing things is immoral.
The students in this class are too mischievous. They are constantly thinking up various ways to cause trouble for the new teacher.
I still remember when I was young I ganged up with other classmates and made fun of him.
He is really clever. No matter what method we tried, we didn't succeed in teasing him.

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss

sentence.idiomatic: I wish you happiness in love, that you live to a ripe old age in marital bliss.

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss

sentence.idiomatic: To be able to live together until your old age in marital bliss with the one you love is a very happy thing.

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss

sentence.idiomatic: In the past they had vowed to live together happily married until they grew old. However after a few short years they got divorced.
I've just received a wedding invitation.
Really? Have you attended a wedding reception in China before?
No, I haven't, so I'm especially excited. What are wedding receptions in China like?
First the groom and the bride will stand at the entrance of the restaurant to receive their guests.
Huh? They have the lead role that day. How can they stand at the entrance?
You don't understand. Chinese people feel that the guest coming to attend their wedding reception gives them face. So the newlyweds definitely have to greet their guests at the door.
Oh, that's why. No wonder the groom and the bride have to propose a toast at each table. If it's like that, how much do they have to drink?
That's mainly the job of the best man and bridesmaid. But nowadays the guests won't really force them to drink.
Yeah. The wedding should be joyful, getting drunk is really unpleasant. Hey, how much money should we give in the red envelope?
That depends on your relationship to the groom and the bride. But at least three to five hundred.
That much?
Yeah. But when they are hazing the groom and the bride you can take the opportunity to make them suffer.
Good plan. Hey, how should I congradulate them?

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss

sentence.idiomatic: ``Live to a ripe old age in marital bliss." It means you wish them love until they are old.

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss
live to a ripe old age in marital bliss

sentence.idiomatic: ``Live to a ripe old age in marital bliss. Live to a ripe old age in marital bliss." I've got it.

word.literal: live to a ripe old age in marital bliss
give birth to a son soon
